Authors: N Milatou, M Dassenakis, P Megalofonou
Title: Mercury concentrations in reared Atlantic bluefin tuna and risk assessment for the consumers: To eat or not to eat?
Main Findings/Comments: Reared Bluefin tuna (6 months), Reared bluefin tuna that were found from the Mediterranean Sea has similar Hg concentrations in their muscle tissue to same or other species of Scombridae from the Atlantic, Pacific and Indian oceans. The accumulation of Hg in reared Atlantic bluefin tuna is influenced greatly by their rearing period. Consumers can decrease their exposure to Hg by consuming smaller and younger bluefin tuna and fish that is reared for a longer period.
